data.title: Quiet Flows the Don by Mikhail Sholokhov
data.meta_description: And quiet flows the Don 4 BÃ¤nde - Englische Ausgabe by Sholokhov, Mikhail: and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Hardcover. Condition: Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Fair. Corner unclipped, wear to edges and corners of dustjacket, edges chipped, ripped, creased and worn, some small pieces missing, some wear to covers and spine, mainly edges and corners, corners a little bumped, top and bottom of spine bumped, small rip at top of spine 1 cm, a few small dents on edges of back cover, internally in good condition, pages crisp and clear, inscription and a book plate on front end paper.

Condition: Good. 1968. Fourth Printing. 536 pages. Dust jacket over grey cloth. Light foxing and tanning to pages. More prominent to text block edges, pastedowns and free endpapers. Visible tape stains to pastedowns and free endpapers also. Hinges are lightly cracked, exposing netting; some looseness to binding but pages remain attached. Boards have minor corner bumping and edgewear with mild tanning and scuffing overall. Spine has minor tanning with soft crushing to ends. Book has a slight forward lean. Unclipped dust jacket with minor rubbing, chipping and tearing to edges. Moderate tanning and scuffing overall.

hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. 26th impression 1970. Hardcover with tight binding. Condition: Very Good. Clean and bright text. Includes a dust jacket, price clipped, in near mint condition. ALL ITEMS ARE DISPATCHED FROM THE UK WITHIN 48 HOURS ( BOOKS ORDERED OVER THE WEEKEND DISPATCHED ON MONDAY) ALL OVERSEAS ORDERS SENT BY TRACKABLE AIR MAIL. IF YOU ARE LOCATED OUTSIDE THE UK PLEASE ASK US FOR A POSTAGE QUOTE FOR MULTI VOLUME SETS BEFORE ORDERING.

Condition: Very Good. Very Good condition. Acceptable dust jacket. No date stated. Book 3. (russian literature, historical fiction, novel) A copy that may have a few cosmetic defects. May also contain a few markings such as an owner's name, short gifter's inscription or light stamp.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Good. Part Four (of four) only. Translated into English by Stephen Garry. 864pp. In brown cloth boards, top edge sprayed red, silk ribbon marker bound in, textured endpapers. Chunky 12mo. Cloth a little rubbed at spine tips, ribbon marker fraying at end, else neat, clean, bright and tight. In its original dust jacket (worn, chipped at edges, rubbed and rounded on corners at spine ends with some minor loss). no.

Hardcover. Condition: Good+. Dust Jacket Condition: Good. 4 vols. Brown cloth boards, titles in black on spine, facsimile signature of Sholokhov on front board. Bindings secure, spines straight, corners solid. Water damage inside Vol 1, staining about half of the inside of the front board, the frontispiece, and a couple of blank pages. Does not reach title page or text block. Smaller water stain at lower edge of back board and in crease between final few pages. Again no evidence of staining to text block. No damp staining to other volumes. Wear to dust jackets, but each volume does have its jacket. Seldom seen in all four volumes, more seldom still with all four volumes in jackets. 12mo.

Hardcover. Condition: GOOD. Dust Jacket Condition: Acceptable. 6th printing 1978. Sixth Printing. The complete 4 volumes all with dust jackets. Bright yellow cloth boards with a single red logo of publisher on front, black titles on spines. Each Volume has the previous owner's name and date in pen on each flyleaf. Books One - Three have additional pen markings on the rear flyleaf in top corners. Each volume has foxing on leading edges with light pen markings; foxing on endpapers continued through to the title pages. All have dust jackets which have tears and chips missing at edges of spines and at all corners. Considered one of the most significant works of literature in the world.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. First Thus. First Editions Thus, 13th Printings (Sept 1946). Not price-clipped ($7.50 price intact on each volume). Published by Alfred A. Knopf, 1934. Octavos. Blue cloth boards stamped in black with red topstains. 2 volumes in slipcase. Books are very good; with no writing or names. Sharp corners, bindings tight and pages crisp. Slight spine leans and spine fading on boards. Dust jackets are very good with shelf wear, edge wear, and small tears. Slipcase is good with edge wear and tears. Top panel attached on one side. A very good set of one of the most significant works of 20th century Russian literature. 1325 total pages. 100% positive feedback. 30 day money back, guarantee. NEXT DAY SHIPPING! Excellent customer service. Please email with any questions or if you would like a photo. All books packed carefully and ship with free delivery confirmation/tracking. All books come with free bookmarks. Ships from Southampton, New York. We Buy Books! Individual titles, libraries, collections. Message us if you have books to sell!.

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. Dust Jacket Included. 1st Edition. Octavos, dark blue textured cloth covers with gilt titles, ribbon markers bound in. Vol. 1, 750 [2] pages; Vol. 2, 860 [2] pages. A very little bit of foxing on endpapers. Books and dustjackets are in near fine condition. Two isbns: 5-050016800; 5-050016827. 082504B.

Edition : 2nd Impression , Full publisher?s cloth, Mikhail Aleksandrovich Sholokhov (May 24 (May 11] 1905 ? February 21, 1984) was a Soviet/Russian novelist and winner of the 1965 Nobel Prize in Literature. An asteroid in main-belt is named after him, 2448 Sholokhov., Size : 12mo (110mm x 162mm ) , Volume : 4 Volumes, Stephen Garry volume 1 lacks dust-jacket. On the other 3 volumes the dust-jackets are worn.Generally in very good condition. Signature of previous owner on front endpaper.
